docs.text: Chapter 1 - Accounting of Shares and Debentures Before moving ahead and understand the shares lets understand the company first. Company A company is: A voluntary and Autonomous Association of certain persons whose joint capital is divided into numerous transferaable shares to carry out a particular purpose / goal in common It is also known as an artificial person created by law to achieve the object Characteristics of a company The main characteristics of a company are: It is a distinct legal person existing independent of its members Liability of the members is limited to the extent of the face value of shares held by them. It has a perpetual succession, i.e, the members of the company may keep on changing from time to time but this does not affect the company’s continuity. The shares of a company are freely transferable except in case of a Private limited Company. A company being a legal person is capable of owing, enjoying and disposing of the property in its own name. A company, being a separate body can sue and be sued in its own name. Though a company is an artificial person yet it acts through human beings who are called directors of the company. There is a divorce between ownership and the management It is a voluntary association of persons usually for profit
